ovdesc.p: This table specifies the parameters for use by the Core routine
(attached in the field FX.ROUTINE of LIMIT.PARAMETER) while processing the outstanding of a FX Limit.
Default SYSTEM record setup will be used. Netting will be carried out for All customers.
Having only Counter Party level setup will make netting to happen only for specific counter party.
SYSTEM setup allowed to reverse when NET.OUTSTANDING is set 'N' in the LIMIT.PARAMETER.
If SYSTEM and Counter Party level setup exists, Counter party level setup will take precedence.

desc.p: Specifies whether all outstanding transactions need to be revalued on-line, while processing the outstanding of a FX Limit using the core routine FX.LIMIT.NETTING.I.
Valid values are YES or NO.
Specifies the Percentage to be applied on Replacement Value (Customer Loss), while calculating the Limit outstanding using the Core routine FX.LIMIT.NETTING.I.
Specifies whether Forward or Spot rates are to be used for calculating the Profit/Loss, while processing the outstanding of a FX Limit using the Core routine FX.LIMIT.NETTING.I.
If FWD or SPOT, then Forward or Spot rates respectively would be used for calculating the Profit/Loss of Forward Contracts.
Profit/Loss of Spot Contracts would be always calculated using the Spot Rates irrespective of the value in this field.
Valid values are FWD or SPOT.
Specifies the Percentage to be applied on Customer Profit, while calculating the Limit outstanding using the Core routine FX.LIMIT.NETTING.I.
Should be SYSTEM or the ID of a valid CUSTOMER Record.
Specifies the FX Limit Reference for which the parameters in the associated fields would apply while processing the Limit Outstanding using the core routine FX.LIMIT.NETTING.I.
If the value is ALL, then the parameters in the associated fields would apply to all remaining FX Limit Sub-Product References, not explicitly specified here.
Valid Fx Limit.Reference ID with field FX.OR.TIME.BAND set to FX.
Only sub-product Limit References are allowed.
Associated with the fields LIMIT.REFERENCE to RATE.USED.
Specifies the type of Netting to be used, while processing the Limit Outstanding using the core routine FX.LIMIT.NETTING.I.
Valid values are MULTI, NONE and PAIRED.
